Module nativereflector.main
Package io.github.noeppi_noeppi.tools.nativereflector

Class ModuleManager

java.lang.Object
io.github.noeppi_noeppi.tools.nativereflector.ModuleManager
public class ModuleManager extends Object
Some functions to alter modules at runtime even if you could not do normally. You can for example mark java.base an automatic module or open a package from any module to your module.

      public ModuleManager()

  • Method Details

    • addModuleFlags

      public static void addModuleFlags​(Module module, ModuleDescriptor.Modifier... flags)
      Adds the given module flags to a module. Does only work for named modules.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the module is not named.

    • removeModuleFlags

      public static void removeModuleFlags​(Module module, ModuleDescriptor.Modifier... flags)
      Removes the given module flags from a module. Does only work for named modules.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the module is not named.

    • forceOpen

      public static void forceOpen​(Module from, String pkg, Module to)
      Opens a package from one module to another module without checks on whether this should be allowed.
      Parameters:
      from - The module that contains the package to be opened.
      pkg - The package that should be opened.
      to - The target module to which the package should be opened.

    • forceExport

      public static void forceExport​(Module from, String pkg, Module to)
      Exports a package from one module to another module without checks on whether this should be allowed.
      Parameters:
      from - The module that contains the package to be exported.
      pkg - The package that should be exported.
      to - The target module to which the package should be exported.

    • forceRead

      public static void forceRead​(Module from, Module to)
      Makes it possible for a module to read another module without checks on whether this should be allowed.
      Parameters:
      from - The module that is reading the other module.
      to - The module that is read by the other module.
